intro: Ayenia ambongensis, commonly known as the Ambongensis Aynia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun exposure for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution, Ayenia ambongensis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
